page.title: 03Rockland St.Mary
page.content: Rockland St.Mary started off as a small,farming,brickmaking village.It seemed way out in the country then, when Norwich wasn't so big,but now it is only a few miles away from the outer suburbs of Norwich.The type of housing is very mixed and there is a great variety of age.However,most of the houses were built in the early 1930's at the centre of the village and the newer houses surround them.This suggests the village started developing and enlarging after the 1930's.Even so,development of the village can not be too extensive as there has been a"Green Belt"order placed upon the village ordering all occupents not to build or extend houses any further behind the street than it is at the moment.In the village there appears to be 2 age groups,the young and the elderly.
